skillStatement: Implement plans to address resourcing needs and solve problems.

occupations.name: Chief Executives
occupations.description: Determine and formulate policies and provide overall direction of companies or private and public sector organizations within guidelines set up by a board of directors or similar governing body. Plan, direct, or coordinate operational activities at the highest level of management with the help of subordinate executives and staff managers.

occupations.name: General and Operations Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the operations of public or private sector organizations, overseeing multiple departments or locations. Duties and responsibilities include formulating policies, managing daily operations, and planning the use of materials and human resources, but are too diverse and general in nature to be classified in any one functional area of management or administration, such as personnel, purchasing, or administrative services. Usually manage through subordinate supervisors. Excludes First-Line Supervisors.

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.detailed: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Marketing and Sales Managers

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Sales Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the actual distribution or movement of a product or service to the customer. Coordinate sales distribution by establishing sales territories, quotas, and goals and establish training programs for sales representatives. Analyze sales statistics gathered by staff to determine sales potential and inventory requirements and monitor the preferences of customers.

occupations.name: Industrial Production Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.

occupations.name: Transportation, Storage, and Distribution Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate transportation, storage, or distribution activities in accordance with organizational policies and applicable government laws or regulations. Includes logistics managers.

occupations.name: Construction Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, budgeting, and implementation. Includes managers in specialized construction fields, such as carpentry or plumbing.

occupations.name: Social and Community Service Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of a social service program or community outreach organization. Oversee the program or organization’s budget and policies regarding participant involvement, program requirements, and benefits. Work may involve directing social workers, counselors, or probation officers.

occupations.name: Cost Estimators
occupations.description: Prepare cost estimates for product manufacturing, construction projects, or services to aid management in bidding on or determining price of product or service. May specialize according to particular service performed or type of product manufactured.

occupations.name: Management Analysts
occupations.description: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants. Excludes “Computer Systems Analysts” (15-1211) and “Operations Research Analysts” (15-2031).

occupations.broad: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.detailed: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.name: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.detailed: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.name: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.detailed: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.detailed: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Community Health Workers
occupations.description: Promote health within a community by assisting individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. Serve as an advocate for the health needs of individuals by assisting community residents in effectively communicating with healthcare providers or social service agencies. Act as liaison or advocate and implement programs that promote, maintain, and improve individual and overall community health. May deliver health-related preventive services such as blood pressure, glaucoma, and hearing screenings. May collect data to help identify community health needs. Excludes “Health Education Specialists” (21-1091).

occupations.name: Librarians and Media Collections Specialists
occupations.description: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library’s media equipment.

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.detailed: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Instructional Coordinators

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Instructional Coordinators
occupations.description: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
occupations.detailed: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
occupations.name: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
Registered Nurses
occupations.description: Assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration required. Includes Clinical Nurse Specialists. Excludes “Nurse Anesthetists” (29-1151), “Nurse Midwives” (29-1161), and “Nurse Practitioners” (29-1171).

occupations.major: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
occupations.detailed: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
occupations.name: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations

skillStatement: Evaluate the role of human resource planning to meet an organization's needs.

occupations.name: Chief Executives
occupations.description: Determine and formulate policies and provide overall direction of companies or private and public sector organizations within guidelines set up by a board of directors or similar governing body. Plan, direct, or coordinate operational activities at the highest level of management with the help of subordinate executives and staff managers.

occupations.name: General and Operations Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the operations of public or private sector organizations, overseeing multiple departments or locations. Duties and responsibilities include formulating policies, managing daily operations, and planning the use of materials and human resources, but are too diverse and general in nature to be classified in any one functional area of management or administration, such as personnel, purchasing, or administrative services. Usually manage through subordinate supervisors. Excludes First-Line Supervisors.

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.detailed: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Marketing and Sales Managers

occupations.minor: Advertising, Marketing, Promotions, Public Relations, and Sales Managers
occupations.name: Sales Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the actual distribution or movement of a product or service to the customer. Coordinate sales distribution by establishing sales territories, quotas, and goals and establish training programs for sales representatives. Analyze sales statistics gathered by staff to determine sales potential and inventory requirements and monitor the preferences of customers.

occupations.name: Administrative Services Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate one or more administrative services of an organization, such as records and information management, mail distribution, and other office support services. Medical records administrators are included in “Medical and Health Services Managers” (11-9111). Excludes “Facilities Managers” (11-3013) and “Purchasing Managers” (11-3061).

occupations.name: Industrial Production Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.

occupations.name: Transportation, Storage, and Distribution Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate transportation, storage, or distribution activities in accordance with organizational policies and applicable government laws or regulations. Includes logistics managers.

occupations.name: Construction Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, budgeting, and implementation. Includes managers in specialized construction fields, such as carpentry or plumbing.

occupations.name: Social and Community Service Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of a social service program or community outreach organization. Oversee the program or organization’s budget and policies regarding participant involvement, program requirements, and benefits. Work may involve directing social workers, counselors, or probation officers.

occupations.name: Managers, All Other
occupations.description: All managers not listed separately.

occupations.name: Cost Estimators
occupations.description: Prepare cost estimates for product manufacturing, construction projects, or services to aid management in bidding on or determining price of product or service. May specialize according to particular service performed or type of product manufactured.

occupations.name: Management Analysts
occupations.description: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants. Excludes “Computer Systems Analysts” (15-1211) and “Operations Research Analysts” (15-2031).

occupations.name: Environmental Engineers
occupations.description: Research, design, plan, or perform engineering duties in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental hazards using various engineering disciplines. Work may include waste treatment, site remediation, or pollution control technology.

occupations.broad: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.detailed: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.name: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety

occupations.broad: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.detailed: Health and Safety Engineers, Except Mining Safety Engineers and Inspectors
occupations.name: Health and Safety Engineers, Except Mining Safety Engineers and Inspectors
occupations.description: Promote worksite or product safety by applying knowledge of industrial processes, mechanics, chemistry, psychology, and industrial health and safety laws. Includes industrial product safety engineers.

occupations.broad: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.name: Industrial Engineers
occupations.description: Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination. Excludes “Health and Safety Engineers, Except Mining Safety Engineers and Inspectors” (17-2111).

occupations.name: Engineers, All Other
occupations.description: All engineers not listed separately. Excludes “Sales Engineers” (41-9031), “Locomotive Engineers” (53-4011), and “Ship Engineers” (53-5031).

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.detailed: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.name: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Aerospace Engineering and Operations Technologists and Technicians
occupations.name: Aerospace Engineering and Operations Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Operate, install, adjust, and maintain integrated computer/communications systems, consoles, simulators, and other data acquisition, test, and measurement instruments and equipment, which are used to launch, track, position, and evaluate air and space vehicles. May record and interpret test data.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Civil Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Apply theory and principles of civil engineering in planning, designing, and overseeing construction and maintenance of structures and facilities under the direction of engineering staff or physical scientists.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.name: Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Apply electrical and electronic theory and related knowledge, usually under the direction of engineering staff, to design, build, repair, adjust, and modify electrical components, circuitry, controls, and machinery for subsequent evaluation and use by engineering staff in making engineering design decisions. Excludes “Broadcast Technicians” (27-4012).

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Electro-Mechanical and Mechatronics Technologists and Technicians
occupations.name: Electro-Mechanical and Mechatronics Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Operate, test, maintain, or adjust unmanned, automated, servomechanical, or electromechanical equipment. May operate unmanned submarines, aircraft, or other equipment to observe or record visual information at sites such as oil rigs, crop fields, buildings, or for similar infrastructure, deep ocean exploration, or hazardous waste removal. May assist engineers in testing and designing robotics equipment.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Environmental Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Apply theory and principles of environmental engineering to modify, test, and operate equipment and devices used in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental problems, including waste treatment and site remediation, under the direction of engineering staff or scientists. May assist in the development of environmental remediation devices.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Industrial Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Apply engineering theory and principles to problems of industrial layout or manufacturing production, usually under the direction of engineering staff. May perform time and motion studies on worker operations in a variety of industries for purposes such as establishing standard production rates or improving efficiency.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Mechanical Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Apply theory and principles of mechanical engineering to modify, develop, test, or adjust machinery and equipment under direction of engineering staff or physical scientists.

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Calibration Technologists and Technicians
occupations.description: Execute or adapt procedures and techniques for calibrating measurement devices, by applying knowledge of measurement science, mathematics, physics, chemistry, and electronics, sometimes under the direction of engineering staff. Determine measurement standard suitability for calibrating measurement devices. May perform preventive maintenance on equipment. May perform corrective actions to address identified calibration problems. Excludes “Medical Equipment Preparers” (31-9093) and “Timing Device Assemblers and Adjusters” (51-2061).

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters, All Other
occupations.name: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters, All Other
occupations.description: All engineering technologists and technicians, except drafters, not listed separately.

occupations.detailed: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists

occupations.detailed: First-Line Supervisors of Housekeeping and Janitorial Workers
occupations.name: First-Line Supervisors of Housekeeping and Janitorial Workers
occupations.description: Directly supervise and coordinate work activities of cleaning personnel in hotels, hospitals, offices, and other establishments.

occupations.name: First-Line Supervisors of Personal Service Workers
occupations.description: Supervise and coordinate activities of personal service workers.

occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.

occupations.name: Transportation, Storage, and Distribution Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate transportation, storage, or distribution activities in accordance with organizational policies and applicable government laws or regulations. Includes logistics managers.

occupations.name: Construction Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, budgeting, and implementation. Includes managers in specialized construction fields, such as carpentry or plumbing.

occupations.name: Social and Community Service Managers
occupations.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of a social service program or community outreach organization. Oversee the program or organization’s budget and policies regarding participant involvement, program requirements, and benefits. Work may involve directing social workers, counselors, or probation officers.

occupations.name: Cost Estimators
occupations.description: Prepare cost estimates for product manufacturing, construction projects, or services to aid management in bidding on or determining price of product or service. May specialize according to particular service performed or type of product manufactured.

occupations.name: Management Analysts
occupations.description: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants. Excludes “Computer Systems Analysts” (15-1211) and “Operations Research Analysts” (15-2031).

occupations.broad: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.detailed: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety
occupations.name: Industrial Engineers, Including Health and Safety

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.detailed: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.name: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians

occupations.minor: Drafters, Engineering Technicians, and Mapping Technicians
occupations.broad: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.detailed: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters
occupations.name: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.detailed: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.detailed: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists

occupations.minor: Counselors, Social Workers, and Other Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Community and Social Service Specialists
occupations.name: Community Health Workers
occupations.description: Promote health within a community by assisting individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. Serve as an advocate for the health needs of individuals by assisting community residents in effectively communicating with healthcare providers or social service agencies. Act as liaison or advocate and implement programs that promote, maintain, and improve individual and overall community health. May deliver health-related preventive services such as blood pressure, glaucoma, and hearing screenings. May collect data to help identify community health needs. Excludes “Health Education Specialists” (21-1091).

occupations.name: Librarians and Media Collections Specialists
occupations.description: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library’s media equipment.

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.detailed: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Instructional Coordinators

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.name: Instructional Coordinators
occupations.description: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.

occupations.minor: Other Educational Instruction and Library Occupations
occupations.broad: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
occupations.detailed: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
occupations.name: Miscellaneous Educational Instruction and Library Workers
Registered Nurses
occupations.description: Assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration required. Includes Clinical Nurse Specialists. Excludes “Nurse Anesthetists” (29-1151), “Nurse Midwives” (29-1161), and “Nurse Practitioners” (29-1171).

occupations.major: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
occupations.detailed: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
occupations.name: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
